column4: i can't find gnome-libs package or gnome-config .....would it be possible to install it from a .deb source?
I don't want to  have to leave ubuntu so i can compile sources on freshmeat.net :(
i cant find it anywhere in the ubuntu edgy repositories but i was able to find it on debian's site
i can't find any way tocompile this
trying to compile a mathematics program and it complains of having not found gnome-config and some file in gnome-lib a file named gnomeConf.sh
did ubuntu leave anything out of gnome?
development libraries, headers, and tools are not installed by default... you probably need to install the proper -devel package
you can search for which package ( if any ) contains a specific file on packages.ubuntu.com
I can't find the development files i neeed but they ARE in debian though
in which package?  they are probably the same in ubuntu
gnome-libs and gnome-config
have you installed gnome-libs?
I'm still not having any luck..would switching to a distro that has those packages work? or would it be easier to just install mandriva

try reading the readme in this package... it should tell you what libraries you need to build it, and are you sure you don't have the files already and it just isn't finding them ( not looking in the right place? )?
i can't find anything with the name of gnome-libs or gnome-config
I see gnome-libs-data
try libgnome-dev.... and do you have a specific file name it says it can't find?
is mandriva easier than ubuntu?
I have no knowlege of mandriva
how can i find the files i need
did you try the libdev package I sugested?  or searching for the file on packages.ubuntu.com?
then go download the sourece tarball yourself
